result.execSummary:
The defendant Theodore L Karlstedt was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal 4th+) [Modifiers: Penalty - Operating While Revoked (Misdemeanor)], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 343.44(1)(b).
  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Court advised defendant of the DNA submission requirement.  Fine and costs payable as follows:  $50.00 per month, starting on or before January 1, 2017 and on the same day each month thereafter, until paid in full.    Failure to pay any part of the fine or court costs in full by the due date will result in 1 day jail for each $25 left unpaid.  $15.00 payment plan fee added.
Sentence to start on or before January 6, 2017 at 6:00 pm.  If he operates a motor vehicle illegally, or has possession of THC, sentence to start immediately.   EMP allowed, according to jail rules.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Arrest-Bench Warrant FTP Capias/Letter
Payment Plan Request.  Must pay 25% ($405.00) before released.  Granted $100.00/month beginning 2-25-17.

DA Gerald Fox appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in person and with Attorney Satorius.  Defendant plead no contest to counts 1 and 2 as charged.  Count 3, dismissed, but read in for sentencing purposes.  Court recited the charges and possible penalties on the counts he plead to.  Defendant understood.  Court reviewed the plea questionnaire, constitutional rights and elements with the defendant. Defense stipulated that there is a factual basis for the plea.   Court found that the defendant freely, voluntarily, knowingly and intelligently entered his pleas and waived his constitutional rights.  Court found that a factual basis exists for the plea.  Found guilty of  OAR, contrary to 343.44(1)(b) and Possession of THC, contrary to 961.41(3g)(e).  State recommended:  $100 fine, plus costs on count 1.  Count 2, 30 days jail.  

Court ordered:  Count 1:  $100.00 fine, plus costs.  Pay @ $50/mo starting 1/1.    Failure to pay any part of the fine or court costs in full by the due date will result in 1 day jail for each $25 left unpaid.  Count 2.  30 days jail, starting on or before January 6, 2017 at 6:00 pm.  If caught for possession or OAR before then, start immediately.    EMP allowed, according to jail rules.  Court advised defendant of the DNA submission requirement.
Plea/sentencing hearing on December 5, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
DA Gerald Fox appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in person and with Attorney Satorious.  Set for plea/sentencing.

DA Gerald Fox appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared late.   Warrant quashed.    Attorney Travis Satorius appeared in court.  Waive reading of the complaint.  Defendant stood mute.  NGP entered by the court.  PTC set for 10/19 and STC 11/7 at 3 pm.

Pre-trial conference on October 19, 2016 at 10:00 am.
Status conference on November 7, 2016 at 03:00 pm.

Defendant shall not operate a motor vehicle on the highways until properly reinstated in the State of Wisconsin.    Not to possess or consume any controlled substances.   Not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Not to possess any prescription medications of any kind unless those have been prescribed to the defendant by a physician, and in that case, the defendant shall take such medications only as prescribed.  Defendant shall not alter the form of any prescription prior to, or in conjunction with, ingestion.
convert bond.
DA Gerald Fox appeared for the State.  Defendant did not appear for the AIA.   Attorney Travis Satorius appeared in court.  Warrant authorized.

Defendant shall not operate a motor vehicle on the highways until properly reinstated in the State of Wisconsin.    Not to possess or consume any controlled substances.   Not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Not to possess any prescription medications of any kind unless those have been prescribed to the defendant by a physician, and in that case, the defendant shall take such medications only as prescribed.  Defendant shall not alter the form of any prescription prior to, or in conjunction with, ingestion.
Adjourned initial appearance on September 26, 2016 at 09:00 am.

Defendant shall not operate a motor vehicle on the highways until properly reinstated in the State of Wisconsin.    Not to possess or consume any controlled substances.   Not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Not to possess any prescription medications of any kind unless those have been prescribed to the defendant by a physician, and in that case, the defendant shall take such medications only as prescribed.  Defendant shall not alter the form of any prescription prior to, or in conjunction with, ingestion.

DA Gerald Fox appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in person, without counsel.  Court recited the charges and possible penalties contained in the complaint.  He understood.  Court explained his attorney options.  He will contact SPD.  AIA set for 9/26 at 9 am.
